creator: francis.andre@easynet.fr
text:
Hi Tomcat People

It happens very often that our customers get difficulties in running Oracle 
JDBC apps with Tomcat due to the fact that Tomcat recognizes only the "jar" 
suffix for library and that Oracle delivers its JDBC driver within a zip 
suffixed file.

Would it be nice to have a option or parameter of Tomcat telling which are the 
suffixes it should take into account when running, with a default to "jar" to 
comply with the actual behavior.

Regards

creator: sreilly@point2.com
text:
Just in case you aren't already aware of this, an easy workaroud to this issue 
is to rename the oracle jdbc drivers with a .jar extension.  Also, AFIAK 
Oracle has smartened up with 9i, and the jdbc drivers are available with 
appropriate extensions.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
This has been reported many many times. I am against implementing such a hack,
sorry.

SRV 9.5.1 in Servlet 2.3 (and 2.4) API spec also states /WEB-INF/lib directory 
has *.jar files. Therefore, it is no wonder for Tomcat as RI of Servlet 
technology to accept only jars in the directory.
